content.question: Which of the following claim and explanation statements best fits these data?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is best modeled by a linear function, because the rate of change over consecutive equal-length input-value intervals is constant.

​​<math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is best modeled by a linear function, because the change in the average rates of change over consecutive equal-length input-value intervals is constant.

​​<math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is best modeled by a quadratic function, because the rate of change over consecutive equal-length input-value intervals is constant.

​​<math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is best modeled by a quadratic function, because the change in the average rates of change over consecutive equal-length input-value intervals is constant.

content.answer: ​​<math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is best modeled by a quadratic function, because the change in the average rates of change over consecutive equal-length input-value intervals is constant.

topic.text: 1.3: Rates of Change in Linear and Quadratic Functions

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Support conclusions or choices with a logical rationale or appropriate data.
